structure.unit: GENERAL PROVISIONS AS TO OFFICES AND OFFICERS -- SOCIAL SECURITY FOR PUBLIC EMPLOYEES -- EMPLOYEES RETIREMENT SYSTEM

law.text:
The secretary shall revoke or suspend the commission of any special law enforcement officer whenever he shall determine:
That the commission-holder does not meet, or no longer meets, the requirements and conditions for the commission; or
That the commission-holder has knowingly falsified an application or portion thereof, or has made any knowingly false or misleading statement of a material fact to the secretary or any of his delegates, agents or officers; or
That the commission-holder has violated: any provision of KRS 61.900 to 61.930; or any rule, regulations or order of the secretary; or any law of the Commonwealth or of the United States, the violation of which the secretary determines to bear a reasonable relationship to eligibility for the commission.
law.history: Created 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 178, sec. 7, effective January 1, 1977.
